üõ°Ô∏è Auto-Moderation Setup Guide

Learn how to configure automatic moderation to keep your Discord server safe from spam, raids, and bad behavior.

1
Access the Dashboard

Log in to the admin dashboard at /dashboard with your Discord account.

Select your server from the server dropdown menu.

üí° Only server admins can access the dashboard

2
Navigate to Server Guard

In the sidebar, click on the "Server Guard" tab.

This is where you'll configure anti-spam and raid protection settings.

3
Enable Spam Detection

Toggle "Enable Spam Filter" to ON.

  • Users per 10 seconds: Set a limit (e.g., 5). Users exceeding this get warned.
  • Ban Raid Users: Toggle ON to automatically ban repeat offenders.
üí° Start with moderate settings and adjust based on your community

4
Configure Bad Word Filter

Toggle "Block Prohibited Words" to ON.

Add words or phrases you want filtered (separated by commas).

  • Matches are case-insensitive
  • Messages with banned words are automatically deleted
  • Users get warned for violations

5
Set Up Logging

Go to the "Logging" tab in the sidebar.

Select a channel for moderation logs:

  • Mod Log Channel: All moderation actions (warnings, bans, kicks)
  • Message Log Channel: Deleted/edited messages
  • Member Log Channel: Joins and leaves
üí° Create a private #mod-logs channel and restrict access to staff

6
Configure Raid Protection

Back in Server Guard, enable "Raid Protection".

  • Set how many new members are allowed per minute
  • Automatically kicks suspected raid bots
  • Restricts new members from speaking immediately

7
Save and Test

Click "Save Changes" to apply all moderation settings.

Test by asking a trusted user to send a test message with a banned word.

‚úÖ Message should be deleted and logged. If yes, moderation is working!
